Html:
I have a simple grammar that parses expression strings, such as: "x < 2 and y >= 3". I have a limited set of "variables" (x, y, etc) so I have them defined as NonTerminal; but if I add X and Y, then x and y won't be parsed correctly. Is there a simple way to set a flag somewhere to make the parses case insensitive or do I have to ToLower everything before passing it to Irony?

Thanks in advance,
Florinator
caseSEnsitive is a parameter to a constructor of Grammar class
Ah, wonderful, I missed that, thank you very much!
